channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024040026
item.description:
Report E-2024040026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to remediate the paint-impacted trailer. All paint-impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.
